title: Build an extremely fun, addicting web game with progression and leaderboard

requirements.text: Create a complete, playable, arcade-style game (single-player) that is immediately fun, easy to learn, and hard to master, with a core loop designed for repeated short runs (e.g., 30–120 seconds) and a clear fail state + instant restart.

quotes: Build an extremely fun and addicting game for me. I give you full permission to do whatever you see fit!

acceptanceCriteria: Game loads into a playable state without requiring setup from the user
A run can be started within 1 click/tap from the landing screen
A run ends with an unambiguous fail state and shows a results screen (score + best score)
Restarting a run takes at most 1 interaction and does not require a full page reload

requirements.text: Implement a polished game feel layer: responsive controls (keyboard + pointer/touch), hit feedback, screen shake/juice (subtle), particle/visual effects, and a difficulty curve that ramps over time to sustain challenge.

quotes: Build an extremely fun and addicting game for me. I give you full permission to do whatever you see fit!

acceptanceCriteria: Keyboard controls work on desktop and touch/pointer controls work on mobile
The difficulty increases during a run (e.g., speed/spawn rate/complexity) and is noticeable by 30 seconds
Collisions/damage/fail events provide clear feedback (visual + optional sound)
The game remains performant (stable frame rate) on a typical laptop browser

requirements.text: Add progression and retention hooks that do not require external services: persistent unlocks/skins/perks earned via play, a simple meta-currency, and at least one “just one more run” mechanic (e.g., near-miss bonus, streak multiplier, or risk/reward pickups).

quotes: Build an extremely fun and addicting game for me. I give you full permission to do whatever you see fit!

acceptanceCriteria: Players earn a currency or progression points during/after runs
At least 3 unlockable items (e.g., cosmetics or minor gameplay perks) are available
Unlock/progression state persists across sessions for the same authenticated user
Progression cannot be trivially lost on refresh (after successful save)

requirements.text: Integrate Internet Identity sign-in and use it to associate saved progression and scores with the user; allow unauthenticated play but clearly prompt sign-in to save progress/submit scores.

quotes: Build an extremely fun and addicting game for me. I give you full permission to do whatever you see fit!

acceptanceCriteria: User can play without signing in
When signed in, the app shows the user is authenticated and enables saving/submitting
When not signed in, the UI communicates that progress/leaderboard submission requires sign-in

requirements.text: Implement a backend-backed global leaderboard (e.g., daily and all-time) with basic anti-spam/anti-cheat constraints appropriate for a casual game (e.g., rate limits per principal, reasonable score validation, and server-side canonical best score tracking).

quotes: Build an extremely fun and addicting game for me. I give you full permission to do whatever you see fit!

acceptanceCriteria: Backend exposes methods to submit a run result and to fetch leaderboard entries
Leaderboard supports at least: all-time top N and a time-bounded board (e.g., daily)
Backend stores a user’s best score and does not allow unlimited rapid submissions (basic throttling)
Frontend displays leaderboards with the current user’s position/best score when signed in

requirements.text: Create a cohesive, distinctive visual theme for the entire game UI (colors, typography, layout, and motion language) and apply it consistently across menus, HUD, results screen, and leaderboard. Do not use a blue/purple default theme.

quotes: Build an extremely fun and addicting game for me. I give you full permission to do whatever you see fit!

acceptanceCriteria: A single, coherent theme is evident across all screens (HUD, menus, modals, leaderboard)
Theme includes a defined palette, typography choices, and consistent component styling
No default-looking unthemed UI remains (e.g., plain browser buttons)
The chosen theme does not rely on a blue/purple primary palette

requirements.text: Add player-facing settings and accessibility basics: volume toggle, reduced motion toggle, control remapping (at least for primary actions on keyboard), and a pause/resume flow.

quotes: Build an extremely fun and addicting game for me. I give you full permission to do whatever you see fit!

acceptanceCriteria: Player can pause and resume a run without breaking game state
Sound can be muted/unmuted and the choice persists locally
A reduced-motion option disables or significantly reduces screen shake and intense motion effects
Primary keyboard action(s) can be remapped in settings

requirements.text: Add generated static art assets for the game (logo, background/scene art, and a small set of icons) and render them in the UI from frontend static files (do not serve images through the backend).

quotes: Build an extremely fun and addicting game for me. I give you full permission to do whatever you see fit!

acceptanceCriteria: Generated images are stored under frontend/public/assets/generated
The app uses the generated logo on the title/landing screen
At least one generated background/scene image is used in the UI (e.g., landing/results)
Icons are used in HUD/buttons (e.g., sound, pause, currency)

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor (all logic in the main actor file)
Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui (compose them instead)
Do not edit immutable hook/bootstrap paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT; integrate via new components/pages/hooks where needed
No external databases or third-party auth providers; Internet Identity only
nonGoals: External analytics, ads, push notifications, or email integrations

required: Arcade game logo with bold, playful typography and simple emblem (game-logo.dim_512x512.png)
High-energy illustrated background with dynamic shapes and motion lines (menu-background.dim_1920x1080.png)
Set of minimal, high-contrast UI icons (pause, play, sound on/off, trophy, coin) as a cohesive set (ui-icons-sheet.dim_1024x1024.png)
